title: Recursive cargo invocation hangs with no indication

labels.name: A-errors
labels.description: Area: Error and warning messages generated by Cargo itself.

body:
# Issue

## Description

Whenever I try to build [`substrate-node-template`](https://github.com/substrate-developer-hub/substrate-node-template) (branch `latest`), it gets stuck building `node-template-runtime`. My CPU goes back down as if the build was over but `cargo build` doesn't exit. I'm on a Mac.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Check out `latest` branch
2. Run `cargo check` or `cargo build` (neither finishes for me)
3. Wait indefinitely (I've waited several hours)

## Expected vs. Actual Behavior

Expected the build to complete successfully.

Actual behavior is that the build never gets past the step of building `node-template-runtime`.

## Environment

- Operating system: MacOS 11.6
- Repo: [`substrate-node-template`](https://github.com/substrate-developer-hub/substrate-node-template)
- Template version/tag: `latest`
- Rust version (run `rustup show`): `rustc 1.56.1 (59eed8a2a 2021-11-01)`

## Logs, Errors or Screenshots

```
Building [=======================> ] 903/907: node-template-runtime(build)
```

(Stuck on this step)

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.56.1 (59eed8a2a 2021-11-01)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 59eed8a2aac0230a8b53e89d4e99d55912ba6b35
commit-date: 2021-11-01
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.56.1
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```

I also tried nightly:

```
rustc 1.58.0-nightly (4961b107f 2021-11-04)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 4961b107f204e15b26961eab0685df6be3ab03c6
commit-date: 2021-11-04
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.58.0-nightly
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```

Original issue: https://github.com/substrate-developer-hub/substrate-node-template/issues/262
